snippet: With the secret FISA court’s approval, the National Security Agency is collecting data not only on terrorism cases but also other foreign intelligence issues like nuclear proliferation and cyberattacks.
abstract: Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court, in more than a dozen classified rulings, has created secret body of law giving National Security Agency power to amass vast collections of data on Americans; rulings reveal that court has taken on much more expansive role by regularly assessing broad constitutional questions and establishing judicial precedents, with almost no public scrutiny.
lead_paragraph: With the secret FISA court’s approval, the National Security Agency is collecting data not only on terrorism cases but also other foreign intelligence issues like nuclear proliferation and cyberattacks.

headline.main: In Secret, Court Vastly Broadens Powers of N.S.A.
headline.print_headline: In Secret, Court Vastly Broadens Powers of N.S.A.
